1.title: Hollywood Done Right
1.plot: In the season premiere, co-hosts Weiss & Bloom take on 3 new films: a Clockwork Orange diatribe, an 80's style drama and a true Hollywood short film which will set the bar high for any new filmmaker.

2.title: Nazis, Graffiti Love and Animal Cruelty
2.plot: Co-hosts review Ronin Jorah's visually stunning WW2 trailer with an extended critique on special effects. Next, they watch a quirky love story & dive deep into a controversial bullfighting doc.

3.title: Hairy Cars, 3D and Human Connections
3.plot: In between the banter on who has the hairiest back, Weiss & Bloom critique 3 new films: a non-story way not to do a 3D, a hairy commercial spot & a quiet story of human connection, no translated needed.

4.title: Love, Laughter and Moments
4.plot: 3 new films are critiqued: a quirky, campy trailer leading to confusion, an old Hollywood romantic short film of two strangers crashing into love & beautiful, magical film exploring life's moments.

5.title: Riots + Sex + Drama
5.plot: After a rocky start & a wardrobe malfunction, the boys critique 3 new films: a street riot protest, an eye-popping, pushing the boundaries intimate film & and a compelling drama of love & loss with a twist.

6.title: Stop-Motion, Prosperity and Young Love
6.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

7.title: Last Laugh
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Artistic Shorts & 1,000 Words
1.plot: The dueling hosts critique an eclectic range of videos, from artistic shorts to "A Thousand Words". When it comes to videos on violence, things get interesting.

2.title: Confidence & Controversy
2.plot: In Round 2, Weiss & Bloom come together in an open critique environment to discuss the filmmaking style of 3 new videos. Both agree, Matthew Brown's "GAY=SIN" is one not to be missed.

3.title: Feet Worshiping & Homeless Portraits
3.plot: Weiss & Bloom critique 5 new Vimeo Films across a myriad of genres: Slow Motion, BMX Bikes, Feet Worshiping & Homeless Portraits. Surprisingly, Steve appreciates a "Non-Horror-Horror" Film.

4.title: Future World & Extreme Sports
4.plot: With a campy start, Weiss + Bloom critique a future world music video and Urban Nature. Next, a skilled shooter with a 5DMK11 creates: "Some of the best skiing footage I've ever seen".

5.title: Memory Banks & Slow Motion
5.plot: Co-hosts Weiss & Bloom critique 3 new Vimeo films: a skate boarding video with some nice slow-motion, Memory Bank: a modern retrospective and a post Obama election celebration on the streets of NYC.

6.title: Brides & Base Jumping
6.plot: Co-hosts Weiss & Bloom open up with some witty banter & critique 4 new shorts: an underground music vid, insane wing-suit base jumping, Trash the Dress Bridal, and a magical love story in Stop Motion.

7.title: Artistic Animation & Zombie Horror
7.plot: Season One wraps up with co-hosts Steve Weiss & Philip Bloom as they critique 4 new shorts: a skillful + artistic animation, a sexy title sequence, a zombie horror and ending with a campy horror film.

1.title: Religion, Love and War
1.plot: Kicking off Season 2, co-hosts Weiss & Bloom critique 3 compelling films of religion, love and war. With nothing off limits, this extended webisode will surely spark controversy & passionate debate.

2.title: Modern Romance & The 80's
2.plot: Co-hosts Weiss & Bloom start off with a few bits of babble before critiquing 3 short films: a dreamy narration of modern romance, an animated music video and an 80's vibe, creative concept film.

3.title: Love, Loss and Loneliness
3.plot: The boys are back to critique 3 new videos: a bizarre music video with interesting styling, a hypnotic stop motion + live projection video and a powerful narration film evoking love, loss and loneliness.

4.title: Justice
4.plot: Following the dramatic Season Finale of FilmFellas Cast 6: There Will be Blood, comes the final chapter of our missing co-hosts. Edited by Philip Bloom & filmed on location at Alcatraz Island.

5.title: Flame & Glory
5.plot: In flame & glory, the dueling co-hosts come back to critique 3 new shorts: an off-the-charts slow motion skate boarding video, a GQ fashion narrative & a trailer with atmospheric, stunning cinematography.

6.title: Life's Moments
6.plot: Co-hosts Weiss & Bloom review a special effects video test & share an extended critique on 16:Moments by Will Hoffman, one of the most viewed films on the Internet, capturing life's everyday moments.

imdb.plot outline: In Critics, film video veterans, Steve Weiss, Director of Film Fellas & Critics, and Philip Bloom, a London based Cinematographer and Filmmaker, come together as dueling co-hosts to candidly critique web based video content. Critics, offering an eclectic mix of personalities, perspectives and laughter.
imdb.title: Critics: A Webisodic Series
plot: In Critics, film video veterans, Steve Weiss, Director of Film Fellas & Critics, and Philip Bloom, a London based Cinematographer and Filmmaker, come together as dueling co-hosts to candidly critique web based video content. Critics, offering an eclectic mix of personalities, perspectives and laughter.::Anonymous
